body_html:
@joel-shor thanks for the great work on TFGAN.

I was wondering the same as @nxphi47 because in the gan_train code I don't see a distinction between training and inference.
I'd suspect during the generator step the discriminator should work in inference mode (passing is_training=false to batch norm and dropout) while during the discriminator step the generator should run in inference mode. I don't see this behavior enforced anywhere in the code. Am I missing something obvious or is this intended?
Unfortunately PR #3370 doesn't exist and I couldn't find the commit you mentioned anywhere in the commit history, could you update the reference?

body:
@joel-shor thanks for the great work on TFGAN.

I was wondering the same as @nxphi47 because in the `gan_train` code I don't see a distinction between training and inference.
I'd suspect during the generator step the discriminator should work in inference mode (passing `is_training=false` to batch norm and dropout) while during the discriminator step the generator should run in inference mode. I don't see this behavior enforced anywhere in the code. Am I missing something obvious or is this intended?
Unfortunately PR #3370 doesn't exist and I couldn't find the commit you mentioned anywhere in the commit history, could you update the reference?
